column4: -rwxrwxrwx three groups of Read / Write / eXecute for for User, second for Group, thrid for Other
microhaxo not true.. there is a version that doesn't.. it's only the "on screen docky thing" that requires compiz
ok you're right about that - as i only use gnome-do for the dock I kinda forget it does do other things as well - my bad
I just tried it and it didn't work for me despite man ls saying it should
with the an example directory, try "ls dirname" vs "ls -l dirname"
s/"ls -l/"ls -d
if I'm in ~ and simply do a ls -d shouldn't it show the directories in ~?
nope
I have to explicitely name the directory?
for the -d to do anything yes

no.. what I mean is if I'm in my home directory and want a listing of just the directories in home then I have to do "ls -d /home/<user> ?? as opposed to being in the home directory and simply doing ls -d ??
i don't know a way (although i'm sure there is one) of listing just directories, but it probably doesn't have anything to do with "ls -d"
take a look at "man ls" .. the -d switch is for directories like you mentioned.. it's just the syntax that's probably messing with us.
the correct syntax is "ls -d */" to get a directory listing.
ok that's kinda a "work-around" but it works :)  thanks, now i know and you did use -d :)
had to go to #linux to get the answer :(
audacity is the sound editor (you got it)
have you tried kino (with gksu) only way i've been able to dump video from 1394

i believe so but don't remember for sure
